resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
js8544 opened a new pull request, #14004:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14004

   The current compute kernel fails to compile with gcc6/7 and c++14/17, due to a known bug of gcc. It is triggered when a const integer is capture by reference in a lambda function, and is parenthesized in that lambda code. Capture the const ints by value fixs this issue and is a performance improvement.
   
   See also:  https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=83204 and https://github.com/kokkos/kokkos-kernels/issues/349

pitrou commented on PR #14004:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14004#issuecomment-1231571800

   Thanks @js8544 . I was actually trying to deal with this in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13991 but I'm glad you found an adequate workaround (and a detailed explanation).

pitrou commented on PR #14004:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14004#issuecomment-1231572906

   > Capturing the const ints by value fixs this issue and is a performance improvement.
   
   I don't really believe the performance improvement claim (do you have any benchmark numbers?), but it's fine as a workaround.

js8544 commented on PR #14004:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14004#issuecomment-1231605178

   > > Capturing the const ints by value fixs this issue and is a performance improvement.
   > 
   > I don't really believe the performance improvement claim (do you have any benchmark numbers?), but it's fine as a workaround.
   
   @pitrou You are right. I should have said "this workaround won't harm anything" rather than calling it an improvement.

ursabot commented on PR #14004:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14004#issuecomment-1232207727

   Benchmark runs are scheduled for baseline = 93b63e8f3b4880927ccbd5522c967df79e926cda and contender = e48afd674552a33eacf860533e5b6c25eca547c6. e48afd674552a33eacf860533e5b6c25eca547c6 is a master commit associated with this PR. Results will be available as each benchmark for each run completes.

ursabot commented on PR #14004:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14004#issuecomment-1232208136

   ['Python', 'R'] benchmarks have high level of regressions.
   [ursa-i9-9960x](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/742fdd2baccf405db3bc1c6a48604902...a65b7abf2f454c848d8db956329838dd/)

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
When compiling the c++ compute component with gcc6/7 with std=c++14/17, compiler internal errors are triggered at compute/kernels/aggregate_internal.h:176:24 and various places at compute/kernels/scalar_set_lookup.cc
{code:java}
cpp/src/arrow/compute/kernels/aggregate_internal.h:176:24: internal compiler error: in maybe_undo_parenthesized_ref, at cp/semantics.c:1740
DCHECK_LT(cur_level, levels);
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~~~

Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.
Please include the complete backtrace with any bug report.
See <https://gcc.gnu.org/bugs/> for instructions. {code}
{code:java}
cpp/src/arrow/compute/kernels/scalar_set_lookup.cc:70:50: internal compiler error: in maybe_undo_parenthesized_ref, at cp/semantics.c:1740
auto on_found = [&](int32_t memo_index) { DCHECK_LT(memo_index, memo_size); };
0x683399 maybe_undo_parenthesized_ref(tree_node*)

../../gcc-7.5.0/gcc/cp/pt.c:15874
0x5d696b tsubst_expr(tree_node*, tree_node*, int, tree_node*, bool)
../../gcc-7.5.0/gcc/cp/pt.c:16090

../../gcc-7.5.0/gcc/cp/pt.c:16090

../../gcc-7.5.0/gcc/cp/pt.c:15845
Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.
Please include the complete backtrace with any bug report.
See <https://gcc.gnu.org/bugs/> for instructions. {code}
 

This is a known bug of gcc6/7. It is triggered when a const integer is capture by reference in a lambda function, and is parenthesized in that lambda code. See also:  [https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=83204] and [https://github.com/kokkos/kokkos-kernels/issues/349]

 

An easy fix is to capture levels and memo_size by value. {-}Since they are ints, capturing by value is also a performace improvement{-}. If there is no objection, I will submit a PR to fix this.
